div.head: In loue to the Author and Cause.
div.l: WHilome the Church was rich, Iustice her due,
Deuotion gaue her plentie: her full chest
With treasure swell'd, which Pietie did accrue,
And Charitie dispence; this time was blest,
Till lawlesse Sacriledge with maine despoile
Seaz'd on the holy Goods, possest her land;
As hostile rage preuailes in conquered soile,
So warr'd the Christian gainst the Church, her hand
(Meane while) was on the common so, which wreaks
Both her and them: a sad-reioycing day:
The peoples gaine, with Churches losse, thus speaks,
Whil'st one obtain's such conquest, both decay.
